revised_title: Late-glacial and Post-glacial History of Chalk Escarpment near Brook, Kent
tldr: This study examines the geomorphology and history of the Chalk escarpment near Brook, Kent, since the end of the Last Glaciation. The research reconstructs the formation of steep-sided valleys, or coombes, and their associated chalk debris deposits. The findings provide insights into the Late-glacial and Post-glacial periods, including the effects of climate change and human activities on the landscape.
